Ratings.comment: Piece of advice you have to agree with them, do not disagree with them on any points of discussion. Not a tough course, but it definitely discusses some obscure topics. Would not take this course again personally.

Glad to be Prof. Cremins' first rating. Took 2230 as a summer class and it didn't disappoint. As long as you read the articles and watch the films and they can tell you've put some thought into you're writing, you'll get an A. They give good feedback and give you extra things to think about without taking off points for expressing your own opinion.

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

Ratings.comment: Prof Byrne is super cool. The reading might be a bit much sometimes and sometimes you can probably just skim but to get the most out of each class you should probs just do it. If you can, integrate Twilight into the discussion as often but as casually as possible. She'll love that.

I just took this class because it seemed like a manageable amount during Zoom University, but it ended up being my favorite class. Women's voices are important, and it was great getting to read women sharing their own stories. I couldn't believe that this was the first class I had learned about some of these topics

I really enjoyed the books we read and watching the lecture videos. Some of the assigned readings were challenging, but she did a great job of explaining both the arguments and the context in the short lecture videos. The class was asynchronous because of COVID, but I wish I could have been in the classroom with Professor Byrne

Not my favorite. For a 3 credit course, she over works her students. Soo much reading its insane. Her grading is very vague and shes a ROUGH grader. I did pretty well in the class, but if youre looking for a GE, I would look elsewhere. She also didnt grade like anything until week 10 and is super slow to grade anything

I was really nervous about taking this class.. That being said, Deja's feedback is constructive. She loves what she teaches. She is very inspiring! It's a shame I will not have the opportunity to take more classes with her as this was a GE course. It's you're loss if you pass up the unique chance to experience her teaching methods.

Professor Beamon is a good professor, all things considered. She offered our course completely online, which means we seldom got to talk to her personally. However, on the few chances we did get to talk with her, she was one of the most caring people in the world. Assignments are often vague and misleading, but I still found her to be a good prof.

The class was discussion based with various books assigned for homework. You were often expected to read 300+ pages in 2 days. Lots of response papers with vague instructions and grading criteria. No tests, just projects. Divided into groups for final project, but given next to no instruction. She is a tough grader, but is a nice person.

This class was very fun and she was a good professor. I could tell that she really cared about the students and she made the online environment a comfortable one. You will have to read some longer papers (skimming them works), but you will also have to write essays for this course. Overall, if you try you'll be fine.

Readings were well-selected and engaging. This professor has a passion for the course material. Often had unclear grading criteria with no used rubric for essays. Lots of reading overall. At one point in the semester three essays were due over three weeks. Not a bad course or professor but there are better options. Final paper instead of exam.

This professor I have no words. She expected us to read like a whole book every single week and then write a 300 word essay on the whole book that needed detail and everything. I never got above a 90 on any of my essays and this was just not fair. There was never a steady rubric so I never knew why I missed points. Never take this class for a GE.

The professor has no soul. Despite suffering from many physical and mental ailments during this fully-online course, I was still expected to meet all deadlines with little to no flexibility. This class was so depressing, and it honestly made me want to drop out of college. She does not care about her students; do not take this class ever.

The cutoff for an A is a 95 in this HONORS class. I do not recommend you take this class, unless you want to spend all your free time reading books and writing papers. Expect low grades and little to no feedback. Suparna i does not provide enough flexibility in extensions for medical conditions, which is absolutely ridiculous considering COVID-19.

Raised A cutoff to a 95, and never gave a paper grade over a 96 to anyone. Took off points without providing a reason, even when meeting privately. We read entire books in a week, expected to write 100 word max discussion posts and 300-500 word max essays with an unreasonable expectation of detail. Take a class with a normal grade scale.

She was a very tough grader and never really told you what she wanted in a paper or how to improve your work. I was sick during the semester and had an excuse and she still failed me for two major although I did them, making my grade drop for the rest of the semester and I was unable to fix it in time. She never answered her email either.

Gave little to no feedback, not even a rubric. Our entire class recieved "good start" for our feedback on an assignment. Expected an unreasonable amount of detail in essays that had a maximum word count of 300. Increased cutoff for an A despite grading ridiculously hard. Take another class to fill your social diversity rq.

SEI.Subject: AFAMAST
SEI.Class Name: Race and Public Policy in the United States

SEI.Subject: PUBAFRS
SEI.Class Name: Race and Public Policy in the United States
SEI.College: John Glenn College of Pub Aff
SEI.Department: John Glenn College of Pub Aff

SEI.Subject: PUBAFRS
SEI.Class Name: Race and Public Policy in the United States
SEI.College: John Glenn College of Pub Aff
SEI.Department: John Glenn College of Pub Aff

SEI.Subject: PUBAFRS
SEI.Class Name: Race and Public Policy in the United States
SEI.College: John Glenn College of Pub Aff
SEI.Department: John Glenn College of Pub Aff

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Natives and Newcomers: U.S. Immigration and Migration

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Health and Inequality

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Natives and Newcomers: U.S. Immigration and Migration

Ratings.comment: They were an awesome instructor and genuinely cared about the students in the class. Class was discussion based, and we were assigned various articles and videos to read/watch before class. No real tests, just a few response papers and a final paper. The discussions were very engaging, and I had a great time. Joe is very accommodating as well.

I took the class just to fulfill a gen ed requirement and found myself really enjoying the course and the material. Joe is an amazing instructor, and I highly recommend them for any classes that they teach!

She incorporates her experience in the field and information from other classes for a well-rounded education. She's always worrying that she's not letting us talk enough and would rather that we guide the discussion. She partially leads the OPEEP program with the local prison. We only had one final project that was largely a participation grade.

Thomas is a great professor, she cares about her students and what's going on in their life. Cancelled class a few times because of midterms/finals in other classes. Even brought donuts to our last class. Definitely tries to make genuine connections with students. Do the readings, participate in discussions, and complete the final project for an A.

Even though the course was virtual & asynchronous, I felt connected to her. She created a welcoming, inclusive, accepting environment. Very flexible with deadlines. Quick response time. Lots of extra credit. Weekly discussion board posts & reading quizzes, midterm with required citations (do the readings!!), and a final essay. Great intro to WGSST

I want to say, i loved all the TAs in this class. But the professor? Thats a different story; It got sour for me when asking to discuss a grade on a midterm, she responded very unprofessionally and rude through an email. In terms of the class, its super easy and the content is enlightening.
Dr. Thomas is amazing! Her class is led by her TAs and is group discussion heavy. Quizzes weakly, 5 questions and fairly easy if you read the assigned readings. Def recommend!

Thomas was a great professor. She really cares about all her students even in my online class. She did great with lectures and got back to me quickly with any questions. The course was interesting and not too difficult. Stay on top of weekly discussions and quizzes and you'll pass with an easy A. Only one midterm and a final writing assignment.

Mary is awesome. I'm taking her class right now and she is so funny and sweet and super smart. She's very in tune with the class and always wants to make sure that everyone is engaged and that the class discussion is meaningful. She's a fair grader, if you put in the effort and show that you actually have read the assignments you'll get an A.

If you get a chance to take a class with Mary Thomas, do it. Her lectures are always interesting, she clearly knows a lot about the material on hand. For this class, there were five assignments throughout the semester, and she's not a bad grader but you have to try. Overall one of my favorite professors at OSU.
Poor at articulating her teachings to the masses
This class was phenomenal. Dr. Thomas is truly passionate and committed to helping students engage critically and thoughtfully with course material.

Mary Thomas is an absolutely wonderful professor. She is a clear lecturer and is obviously interested in her subject area. She's always willing to meet during her office hours and is extremely helpful when it comes to exams.
Mary Thomas rocks. Readings are interesting and the discussion truly becomes a conversation (in a good way).  Slides are clear and detailed.  Tests are fair.  Take this class!!!!

Really awesome teacher. Very straightforward and blunt, but not in an off putting way. Only grades were 3 projects that were more than manageable and exams which were a bit more tricky. Definitely need to study for exams, but you can get by without reading every week as she recommends. Favorite teacher of the quarter when I took the class.
Professor Thomas is always great, and one of the few professors who seems to still like teaching.
She's a tough one, but the class is interesting.
Dr. Thomas is a very articulate, well spoken woman. I respect her significantly. Plus she's funny and easy going.

Cool, hip teacher. Really knows her stuff and makes it fun. Very helpful and fair. Highly recommend her. Does ask for participation in the discussions so be prepared. Her tests are short answer and essay which could be tricky.

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: First-Year Seminar

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: First-Year Seminar

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: First-Year Seminar

SEI.Class Name: First-Year Seminar

SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sex and Power

SEI.Class Name: Feminist Pedagogy

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sex and Power

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Feminist Perspectives of Incarceration in the US

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sex and Power

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sex and Power

Ratings.comment: This course was text heavy. I learned a great deal, my mind was blown in alot of subjects. Communication was clear but grading scale lacked rubric so never knew where I needed to improve.

I learned a lot and I enjoyed the material but there were a lot of long, difficult readings that made it hard to keep up. Dr. Winnubst can be very intimidating which makes it hard when participation is required. Grades were unclear the entire semester and I got little feedback. You'll definitely learn a lot, but be ready to put in the work.

Overall she is a respectable professor and knows what she's talking about. There are a lot of readings, and quite a few were pretty difficult to understand. I learned a lot in this class, but I thought she was intimidating and not always the easiest person to talk to. The course material itself makes this class worth taking though.

She taught this course as if it was a graduate level course. It was mandatory to participate in class, and many people were uncomfortable talking out loud about the topics being discussed. She was extremely intimidating, was very rarely available to talk to outside of class, and never answered emails. Took forever to grade. Would not recommend.

The senior seminar class was honestly a revelation for me. I've never been so connected in a class. It flipped my perspectives of the world. She didn't just give us an intensive workup of neoliberalism, but brought us back to our feminist roots. She never faltered to speak her truth& give us meaningful advice. She cared a ton .
Dr.Winnubst is fantastic.  Her courses are NOT easy, however you will learn a great deal and appreciate her knowledge and enthusiasm.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKING HER COURSES!

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Topics in Feminist Studies

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Women's Studies Senior Seminar

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Feminist Inquiry I

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Race and Sexuality

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Feminist Inquiry I

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Queer Studies

Ratings.comment: This class relied a lot on class discussions and I just hadnt found my voice in the class to speak enough. I spoke to this professor about this and it did seem like it got disregarded. After the switch online she was very considerate and lessened the courseload. Im not sure if we just got off to a bad start but things improved online.

Really nice in lecture, doesn't really talk much and the class is discussion-based. Very minimal in-class work, however, this class definitely feels like another literature class. Super reading heavy, and she is a tough essay grader. The readings are around 80-100+ pages a week sometimes plus a discussion post.

Professor Delgado is super nice, but her class is awful. I feel like I have learned nothing so far. Her method of grading makes no sense. It's unclear what work is mandatory, and the course is just unorganized.

She talks more about how this class will be than about the subject. Expect the sloppiest class possible and little to no learning about whatever her subject is. You will however learn about "true collaboration" and other such nonsense. It's an easy class, but I wouldn't recommend it. A waste of money and time.

Prof Delgado is caring, but I've never had a more disorganized class. The syllabus is pointless because she changes plans every week and nothing is clear about what you should be doing. We spent the entire time in groups doing nothing. Her lectures are confusing and there are no slides to go with them. Didn't even get a grade until the last day.

Professor Delgado definitely cares about her students and knows a lot on her field but be prepared for a different than normal class. You are not graded on specific assignments and will not know your grade until the end of the semester. This was not something I liked personally but as long as you show up and do what is asked of you, you will do ok.

She's a good person who clearly cares about her work, but the class is sloppy and unorganized. She communicates last second about missing, and makes everything an "invite" but takes away points when you don't do it. You spend lots of time in groups and read a lot. I did not have a grade put in for ANYTHING until the last day of the semester.
Great professor, but to some people she may teach kind of weird because she sets her class up in a unique way. I really enjoyed it and I would definitely take another class with her!

Prof. Delgado is super nice and understanding, but she is a terrible prof. Her class is boring and she isnt great at engaging students. She also takes forever to grade papers. Half the class didnt have more than 1/4 papers graded until the last week of the semester. We reported her to the department chair 2x and it didnt help.

Professor Delgado is an amazing woman. She cares tremendously for her students and her compassion is translated through her class. I cannot say enough great things about her. She is so knowledgeable about her field. Amazing prof!

Professor Delgado has been horrible about getting grades back to us. We only have one assignment graded and the semester ends next week... She docs points when your opinion differs with hers. She also cancels classes with less than 20 minutes notice. The class was meant to be in person, but she made it digital with no refund.

While there were bumps in the road in the beginning of the semester, professor Delgado listened to our feedback and made significant changes to the course. She is a very sweet professor and she has amazing intentions but there were problems in the beginning as stated in the previous post.

I havent finished this class yet but I want to warn people if they are thinking of having this prof in the fall. The expectations for papers are super unclear and the class as a whole is extremely confusing and boring. The class got so bad we filed a complaint to the WGSST department. She has since tried to adjust but class still sucks.

Professor Delgado is very nice/caring, but she BARELY showed up to our live sessions & still decided to grade kind of sternly on our work, even though we didnt get clarity from her on a lot ( since we didnt have that many classes). She doesnt reply to emails & she took forever to grade all our work+ finals. Wouldnt rec for online at least.

I genuinely love this woman. She's a genius, is entirely humble, caring and brilliant. She is an expert on Latin America history and women's experiences and tells amazing stories that make sense of all of the court cases and people's lives she has researched. She gives lots of optional readings. I can't recommend her enough. Take her class! Enjoy!

SEI.Subject: HISTORY
SEI.Class Name: Women and Gender in Latin America

SEI.Subject: HISTORY
SEI.Class Name: Colonial Latin America

SEI.Class Name: Women and Gender in Latin America

SEI.Class Name: Higher Power: Feminisms & Religion

SEI.Class Name: Feminist Pedagogy

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Higher Power: Feminisms & Religion

Ratings.comment: Prof Shchurko did work with me when it came to personal issues so I don't see where the other comments are coming from. The class was a little hard and there were a lot of readings (some difficult), but that's to be expected with the content. Regardless of the difficult content you can still get a good grade if you show up to class and participate.

If you have personal problems in your life, don't bother---she doesn't care. Very strict on attendance even if you have appointments or notices. She is NOT disability friendly at ALL. This is consistent. Disorganized class material, no clear expectations because she doesn't announce or publish what she says in class. Says one thing, does another.

The people who've rated this class seem to forget that this is a reading/writing class. I'm not sure what they were expecting. Everything is planned out on the syllabus; read it on time and try to participate in class since participation is also graded. I learned amazing things from this class and Ms. Schurko is a great teacher!

Lots of reading each week--approximately 120+ pages (and be ready to discuss/analyze what you read in class). Major course assignments require a lot of writing as well that feel overwhelming. If you miss a class due to illness, there's a lot of makeup work to do. Easy grader, but heavy workload. Overall, would not recommend taking it with her.
get ready to read an entire book each week. feedback is awful and hard to understand. Discussion heavy. do not take.

SEI.Subject: AFAMAST
SEI.Class Name: Black Women Writers: Text and Context

SEI.Class Name: Black Women Writers: Text and Context

SEI.Class Name: A World of Genders and Sexualities

Ratings.comment: fun class and fun assignments. a lot of assignments relate to real world topics

Most unorganized class I've ever taken. The whole thing is about "beta-testing" how to work as a group... for a fully online class. It's one big group project. She takes off random points and does not tell you why. if you enjoy vague assignments and spending an hour a week trying to figure out what you're even supposed to submit, take this class.

She has the ability to be super nice but she provides not feedback and she never responds to your question. I asked her about a syllabus at the beginning of the semester she never took the time to even answer my question on Carmen. She also tries to be overly unique but in reality she is just weird. I warned you
This professor does not provide use syllabus. She does not offer any assistance and she does not give any type of feedback

absolutely loved this class and this instructor. material was interesting, all of yhe movies were valuable in some way, and the professor was very passionate about the material (in the best way). she cares so much fot her students and people in general, and was very understanding about Life Stuff affecting deadlines

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Studies in Gender and Cinema

Ratings.comment:
WGSST 2367.03 
Professor DeLong is so nice! Group work is heavy but good. No textbooks but we read many short stories and novels and engaged in meaningful discussion. She is very flexible with attendance (be transparent) and the whole class had a sense of a safe place!

This class involved weekly readings and discussion board posts. All readings were posted, and it only took me a day to complete the weekly assignments. The biggest grades were a midterm essay and final project. Instructions & expectations for these assignments were not always clear, but they were quick to respond to emails. Friendly instructor!

Dr. Nieto is WONDERFUL... I would take any class about any subject matter with her. She understands that life happens sometimes, so if you just let her know whats going on, its an easy 100%. Class literally feels like a book club, its amazing.

Professor Nieto is genuinely one of the kindest teachers I have ever had. If you enjoy reading and want a class that feels like a reprieve from your other classes this is the one for you. You will read between six or seven books and write a short paper on each of them. The papers are all only a little over two pages and can be on anything.

There were no lectures for my class and all we had to do was the readings and the papers, which was great! She graded super easy for everything and as long as you tried you would get 100% (even on essays).
Many of the assignments were removed and deadlines were extended
She genuinely cares about her students :)
Weekly discussion posts and three papers. Learned a lot, and was the least stressful course I have taken at OSU. Dr. Nieto wants you to succeed, and everyone should take her class!

Dr. Nieto is the nicest professor I've ever had, period. She actually cares about her students and their wellbeing. If you are struggling in or out of class, all you need to do is talk to her; she is extremely understanding. Her classes are engaging but never unnecessarily difficult. I wish more professors were like her.

WSST 2367.04 consisted of weekly discussion posts, 6-7 books and short papers for all of them (about literally anything pertaining to the book). Dr. Nieto was extremely caring and accommodating, especially during this rough semester. She would extend deadlines often and seemed really sweet overall. Ended with a 100%. Would highly recommend!
Awesome! So understanding and extends deadlines for papers frequently. Discussions are participation and the books you read can be found as pdfs online. Highly recommend.

Professor Nieto is so sweet and cares/understands students have lives outside of class and is very accomodating to do things to work around schedules. Do not take her for granted! She is such a sweet person and gives feedback on all your papers, but do expect to read quite a bit, nothing too major.

Dr. Nieto is the most understanding and caring professor you can have. She understands her students have a life outside of class and is very accommodating. She values her students learning and understanding what she is teaching rather than just checking boxes. 10/10 would recommend
Take WGSST 2230 (I did it online) and it was super easy and Dr. Nieto is amazing! She is super sweet and such an easy grader. The class was interesting and fun!

Weekly assignments and discussions are actually interesting! She proves you to think for yourself and become more analytical. Papers are easy yet interesting. This class is easy and I still got a lot out of it.

She was amazing! If you have a chance to have her as a professor, definitely do it! Over the semester we had to read 4 books and write a paper for each one. As long as you tried on the papers, you will get 100%. We would also have discussions in class, but speaking wasn't graded so you don't have to talk if you don't want to.

Dr. Nieto is incredibly caring and understanding. She understands that we're all really busy and stressed students and because of this, she's very flexible with deadlines. No textbook was required for this course, but be prepared to buy a couple books to read. The material is actually very interesting.
TAKE HER CLASS!!! Such an easy grader and so so nice. She is lovely. Thoroughly enjoyed her class this semester.

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

SEI.Class Name: Food & Gender

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender and Leadership

Ratings.comment: Tons of extra credit opportunities, easy Gened!

WGSST 2230!!! Definitely recommended for a GE. Heavy but interesting topics. Plenty of extra credit opportunities, and  Dr. Livingston does what she can to help students succeed. Asynchronous weekly material makes it very convenient. Just don't procrastinate until the Saturday deadlines, because some of assigned readings are very time consuming.

Kate is fine. Her comments are condescending but she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities, which was nice. The course itself wasn't too bad, but be prepared for lots of heavy readings and discussion boards.

As the other reviews said, there is an insane amount of reading and work for this class. You have multiple scholar-level PDFs to read per week. The final is 63 questions each worth .20 points, and a paper worth 15pts. Her class is not easy, her feedback is condescending, so if you want an easy GE DO NOT TAKE

WAY too much work for a GE class. Weekly assignments that she grades way too harshly for ppl just starting out in WGST. Her feedback is condescending and while the class seems organized, it's not. Contradicting info on assignments, too many details, too many locations for info, etc. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. You almost have to do EC to get an A

She assigns way to much reading for this class, like I'm talking absurd amounts. Every other teacher for this course is an easy A, which is how this elective should be but she makes it super hard. She's super passionate about it and if you are too then take it, but if you just need to get your A&H out of the way take a different teacher!

Kate is honestly one of the best profs I've ever had. She is one of few profs I know that can hold a discussion about tough topics & be neutral & make everyone see a different point of view. She is so well respected that most classes every person shows up which usually doesn't happen with your average professor. Everyone likes her, highly recommend

Kate is the best. She comes into class every day genuinely wanting to have an involved discussion and wanting to hear everyone's opinions. She helped me to view the world in a completely different way. This was the first Women Gender and Sexuality Studies course I've taken, but now I'm planning out my minor.

This professor knows what she's talking about and makes the subject matter very clear. She is engaging and is considerate of your opinion. The class is interesting and I didn't expect to enjoy this class but I really did. I'd recommend this professor.

Supposedly this class was rigorous? I do not agree at all. The class was interesting, when I decided to show up. I have chronically terrible attendance. She is interested in her students, and wants you to do well. Attendance is required, so, if you're like me, you might want to skip this one - I took a hit on that attendance requirement.

Difficult to get accustomed to the course and the professor, takes time to not see her as intimidating. Course material very interesting though and she really does want to hear what you think. I enjoyed the class.

Really amazing teacher, kinda intimidating at times. Originally walked into class thinking it would be a lame radical feminist course. However, the professor does a nice job at seeing both sides to each argument and going beyond just sexism. Not your stereotypical women's studies teacher.

Kate is a phenomenal lecturer. She cares a lot about the class and it rubs off on her students. She is funny and interesting and really tries her best to teach you the material in an engaging way. I'd recommend taking any class she teaches.
Kate is a phenomenal teacher. She's passionate about what she does and she keeps it interesting.

She is very passionate about the course. I wasn't entirely interested in women's studies before taking the course but now I'm planning to take a minor! You'll learn a lot and gain a new perspective after this course.

She is an awesome teacher and very enthusiastic about what she teaches. There is a lot of outside reading to do but it?s worth it. The lectures are very interesting and she always encourages participation from the class. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone whether it?s for a GEC or you just need a class to take.

Great teacher. Keep up with the readings and assignments and you'll do fine. I was not at all interested in this class before taking it and have such a different outlook on feminism after the fact. Very passionate and knowledgeable about what she is teaching and her lecture is always entertaining. I would recommend her to anyone and everyone.

Kate is very interested in teaching and learning. She is an interesting person all around. You should do the readings but she won't be upset if you miss a few. The class isn't too difficult but she makes it interesting. Even if you think you're not interested in WS you will probably find something engaging about this class.

Really loose, is up for anything, not afraid of a challenge, open, dominate for the most part, but submissive when it counts, a very passionate professor, really aims to please her students, and often gives everyone a hand. Overall, you should definitly take her, and stick with it, she can be a bit intense at times, but only bc she's so passionate
Great personality, I really recommend her.

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Gender, Sexuality and Race in Popular Culture

Ratings.comment: She is awesome

Super easy and interesting Gen Ed. Its completely discussion based so if you don't like talking in class every now and then you may not like it but Taneem is great at facilitating discussion and encouraging students. Tests were super easy (no study guide needed at all) and there were two papers to write and pretty short readings before each class.

The material is incredibly interesting, so that made going to class easy.  However, she puts no effort into helping her students.  I asked her for help on a paper and she actually said "no you can figure it out."  As a class, we asked her for some sort of study guide for exams and she said "just read your notes."  She's hot, but sucks at TEACHING.

She was very excited about the material which helped to make class interesting. Used pop culture references to connect the material and stimulate discussion in class. Would definitely recommend taking a class with her.

Very fair grader and actually made class interesting. All I had to do to get an A was read some short novels, discuss them in class and then write a couple papers. I took it in the summer term and it didn't feel fast at all. I would recommend this to get your lit and second writing course overlapped and out of the way!

Taneem is an amazing professor. She is extremely helpful. She makes the class amazingly interesting and uses a lot of current media. Loves teaching the material. If you come to class and ask her questions you'll do amazing. I recommend her in whatever class she may teach. Definitely would love to have her again!
Attendance isn't mandatory, but she does give pop quizzes. And there is no textbook, but there are articles to read for every class. This was my favorite class of the quarter!
Awesome class!  I would take her again, but she is teaching the same class next semester:(  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
This professor is amazing. She is really hot. Is she taken? Her class was really interesting, and she put a good spin on the course relating to the students. Take her!
very rude

I had Prof Kolenz for WGSST 2230. I was excited for the course, it seemed fun- but the way Prof Kolenz formatted the class sucked any joy out of what could have been a good time. Your grade comes from graded notes and what amounts to transcripts of what you contributed in class. She's nice and a good person, but the class was a pain to get through

She was very sweet and welcoming with a great relationship with the students, I loved this class. It was heavy on outside readings and viewings but i found it easy to multitask while doing them. there was a LOT of writing involved with journals, reflections, and essays, as well as a final group project. She's really lovely though and very helpful.
Gives lots of opportunity for extra credit and is extremely flexible with meeting times. She is super nice but very content-heavy course and not an easy marker.
